intro: Ecdysanthera utilis, commonly known as the scarlet spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, three-lobed bracts that surround the flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks. Ecdysanthera utilis is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
